10 of the best rice cookers you can buy on Amazon right now

Whether you just want rice or a fully-cooked meal, we have the cooker for you.
Share
Tweet

See Details

By Rudie Obias2018-10-25 21:32:06 UTC

All rice cookers are not created equal. While some are better than others, there are different rice cookers for different types of people. If you eat a lot of rice, or if you just eat it every once and a while, we've got you covered. 

SEE ALSO: 7 of the best slow cookers right now, according to Amazon reviews

We want to give you the best recommendations that suit your needs because there is no "one size fits all" option when it comes to rice cookers. Some are also more expensive in price, while others can cook different types of rice like brown rice, yellow rice, and even sushi rice, as some just cook plain old delicious white rice. Some kitchen devices multitask as pressure cookers and cake makers in addition to making rice, while there are others that just make a consistent batch of rice each and every time.

Here are the best rice cookers you can buy right now on Amazon.

best high-end option

Image: zojirushi
The Good
Cooks evenly • Portable • Keeps rice warm for up to 24 hours • Wide range of rice types
The Bad
Pricey
The Bottom Line
If you cook a lot of rice, or lots of types of rice, this high-end model may be worth the investment.

1. Zojirushi Induction Heating Rice Cooker

It's pricey, but this well-reviewed pick might be the last rice cooker you'll ever need to buy.
  • Price: $316.34
See Details
If you’re passionate about rice, then the Zojirushi Induction Heating Rice Cooker is a great choice. This rice cooker can handle just about any type of rice you throw at it, including jasmine white rice, mixed rice, sushi rice, porridge, sweet rice, brown rice, and much, much more. 
It cooks up to 5.5 cups, or a little more than 1 liter, of rice. The Zojirushi uses induction cooking with a magnetic field that heats up all sides of the non-stick pot, helping to maintain the temperature for perfect and uniform rice every time. 
The cooker automatically keeps a short warming time after your rice is done cooking, while it could be extended between eight and 24 hours without burning, overcooking, or drying out the fluffy rice inside. It even features various melodies to alert you when your rice is done, while it also comes with a convenient handle — just in case you need to make rice on the go. 
It's easy to clean, making the Zojirushi Induction Heating Rice Cooker ideal for anyone who cooks a lot of different types of rice and wants it consistent and delicious every time. 
The Zojirushi NP-HCC10XH Induction Heating System Rice Cooker comes with a measuring cup and rice paddle. Priced at $316.34, it's one of the most high-end rice cookers on the market, with 80% of reviewers awarding it 5 stars on Amazon.

best multi-purpose option

Image: instant pot
The Good
Cooks rice and millions of other things • Affordable
The Bad
Not made specifically for rice only, if that matters
The Bottom Line
The Instant Pot is a huge hit for a reason: not only can it pressure cook, but it makes great rice, too.

2. Instant Pot LUX V3

The Instant Pot's many cooking options in addition to rice make it a great option, especially if you have limited counter space.
  • Price: $79.00
See Details
This all-in-one pressure cooker from Instant Pot is perfect for anyone who has limited counter space. Not only does it cook the best batch of rice again and again, it also has multiple functions and could also be used as a pressure cooker, slow cooker, steamer, cake maker, and food warmer. There’s also a setting for making soft and hard-boiled eggs, as well as cheesecakes or banana bread.The pressure cooker setting can cook for up to 240 minutes, while it also has cooking delays for up to 24 hours and a warming setting for up to 10 hours. It’s easy-touch controls make it really convenient to just push one button for whatever you’re making, and the cooking pot inside is made of stainless steel and is dishwasher safe. The Instant Pot can even connect to the Amazon Alexa for voice-assisted recipes and personalized shopping lists. Just say something like "Alexa, ask instant pot for an easy Italian recipe" or "Alexa, ask instant pot to find a breakfast recipe," and the Amazon voice assistant will guide you through more than 300 recipe ideas.The best part about the V3 Programmable Electric Pressure Cooker from Instant Pot is its price. With everything it can do for you, it retails for the low price of $79.00. 


best budget option

Image: Hamilton beach
The Good
8-cup capacity • Affordable • Can steam veggies, too
The Bad
No bells and whistles like 24-hour warming
The Bottom Line
If you're just looking for a basic rice cooker, this is your best bet.

3. Hamilton Beach Rice Cooker

This basic rice cooker does exactly what it needs to, and can even steam veggies, too.
  • Price: $29.99
See Details
If you’re on a tight budget, this rice cooker from Hamilton Beach is the one for you. It comes with only one button, so you don’t have to be experienced in the kitchen to make the perfect batch of rice. Just set it and forget it: the rice cooker automatically switches from cooking to warming when the rice is finished. The rice cooker makes up to eight cups with its removable cooking pot, while it can also steam various foods like vegetables, fish, buckwheat, barley, and quinoa with its separate steaming basket, which also doubles as a handy rice rinser. While clean up is a breeze thanks to its non-stick coating, it’s also dishwasher safe to make it even easier to wash.With its multi-functionality and consistency, the Hamilton Beach Rice Cooker is one of the better rice cookers out there if you're on a budget as it'll run you less than $30.


best for large batches

Image: aroma
The Good
Can cook up to 20 cups of rice • Digital controls and presets • Quick Rice option • Steam veggies or fish at the same time
The Bad
Larger than some models, if that matters to you
The Bottom Line
It's hard to find any negatives with this one - the Aroma is great on price point, usability, and versatility.

4. Aroma Digital Rice Cooker

This rice cooker makes enough for an army, can steam veggies or fish at the same time, and all at a great price.
  • Price: $39.90
See Details
This rice cooker can crank out rice for any large family or gathering. The Aroma 20-Cup Digital Rice Cooker can cook any quantity of rice between four and 20 cups with presets for white rice and brown rice. It features easy-to-use and programmable digital controls with automatic "keep warm" setting once the rice is finished. The cooker even has a "Quick Rice" option that can make rice in just 50% of its cooking time.
The cooker also doubles as a slow cooker and steamer with the ability to make entire meals at once. For example: You can steam fish and vegetables in its steaming basket on top, while rice is cooking at the bottom, so you can save time preparing meals. The rice bowl is coated with a non-stick surface and the parts are removable, making clean-up easy.
The Aroma 20-Cup Digital Rice Cooker comes with a cooking pot, steaming tray and basket, measuring cup for rice, serving spatula, and rice paddle. It retails for $39.90.


Best for synchronized cooking

Image: tiger
The Good
Made for making full meals at once • Lots of features in addition to rice cooking
The Bad
Not the absolute cheapest, but not pricey either
The Bottom Line
If you're looking for a rice cooker that does more, this is one of your better choices.

5. Tiger Micom Rice Cooker

This rice cooker is also a pressure cooker, and specializes in making full meals all at once.
  • Price: $70.99
See Details
If you’re looking for a magical appliance that will cook a whole meal for your family, then the Micom Rice Cooker from Tiger Corporation is the one for you. The rice cooker has multiple functions, such as a slow cooker, food steamer, and a pressure cooker that work together to make dinner time a breeze. 
Although it’s minimal in its design, the rice cooker specializes in creating synchronized meals without losing the flavor of each food element. That means you could cook rice, fish, and veggies together without each one smelling and tasting like each other. Tiger manages to do this with its specially designed cooking plate and pot that doesn’t affect the rice’s flavor or texture.
The Tiger Corporation Micom Rice Cooker comes with a non-stick rice paddle and spatula, a cooking plate, a measuring cup, and a cookbook that is full of recipes for "Synchrony-cooking."

best for microwaves

Image: joseph joseph
The Good
Amazing value • Compact and easily stored
The Bad
Must have a microwave to use
The Bottom Line
If you're looking for a cheap, compact solution and you don't mind microwaving your rice, this is your best bet.

6. Joseph Joseph Microwave Rice Cooker

If you're short on space, this microwave rice cooker may be all you need - at a great price.
  • Price: $15
See Details
If you’re really tight on space and simply don’t have room for a countertop rice cooker, this compact rice cooker from Joseph Joseph is completely microwaveable. It cooks up to four cups of rice in about 15-20 minutes, depending on your microwave’s wattage. 
This dishwasher-safe rice cooker comes with a two liter cooking pot that can be used as a colander for washing rice, a measuring cup, and a multi-purpose rice paddle that not only works for serving, but also works as the unit’s locking lid to make sure it stays sealed and as carrying handles for pulling it out of the microwave. The cooker is also stylish enough that you can use it to serve your family and friends. 
Joseph Joseph’s M-Cuisine Microwave Rice Cooker is also reasonably priced at just $15. Unfortunately, microwave not included.


best simple white rice cooker

Image: Zojirushi
The Good
Simple to use, especially for plain white rice
The Bad
Not digital • No presets for other types of rice or grains • Pricey for what it does
The Bottom Line
If you're a white rice fanatic, this is as simple as rice cookers come.

7. Zojirushi Rice Cooker

If you just want a basic, simple cooker for white rice, this could be the one for you.
  • Price: $44.96
See Details
If you’re interested in a simple, no-fuss rice cooker, then Zojirushi has your back. This rice cooker is as easy as they come. Just add the right ratio of rice and water (one cup of rice to two cups of water will usually do it) and press the cooker’s switch to turn on. 
Rice cooks in about 20-25 minutes and will automatically switch to warm once the rice is finished cooking. The non-stick stainless steel rice cooker doesn’t have any fancy knobs or settings for different types of rice. It doesn’t have a delayed warming setting for extended wait times. It just makes a simple and consistent batch of white rice with the ease of pressing down a switch to turn it on. That’s it! And while the measurements are for white rice, reviewers say they have success mixing in other grains like quinoa as well.
The Zojirushi White Rice Cooker makes up to three cups of rice and comes with a measuring cup and rice paddle for your convenience. 



best for dorms or small apartments

Image: BLACK+DECKER
The Good
Super affordable • Compact • Also makes soups, stews, and oatmeal
The Bad
No fancy presets, if that matters to you
The Bottom Line
This compact cooker takes up very little space and cooks more than enough for one person, at an unbeatable price.

8. BLACK+DECKER Rice Cooker

This little cooker makes more than enough for one person, takes up very little space, and costs almost nothing.
  • Price: $15.30
See Details
This is the perfect rice cooker for students living in a dorm room or anyone living in an apartment and lacking space. This compact rice cooker from Black+Decker makes more than enough rice for just one person with its easy-to-use, one-button functionality. 
When the rice is done cooking, it automatically stops working and switches to "keep warm" mode, so the rice stays fluffy and warm for whenever you’re ready to eat. The rice cooker makes small portions between three-to-six cups of rice, as it just takes 20-30 minutes to complete the cooking process. It’s non-stick build makes it easy for clean up, while its plastic rice paddle will prevent scratches when serving. In addition, the cooker is also good for making soups, stews, and oatmeal.
For only $15.30, the Black+Decker RC506 6-Cup Rice Cooker and Food Steamer is also the best bang for your buck purchase for students, young adults, and singles alike.


most stylish option

Image: Cuckoo
The Good
LCD display with six settings • Keeps rice warm for up to 24 hours • TEFLON coating • Looks cool
The Bad
Pricey
The Bottom Line
If you don't mind paying a premium for style, this rice cooker offers a lot of features with its modern look.

9. Cuckoo Electric Heating Rice Cooker

If you don't mind paying more for style, this rice cooker has lots of bells and whistles in addition to its futuristic look.
  • Price: $110.34
See Details
This is the perfect rice cooker for anyone who wants an appliance that will look good sitting on the counter. The CR-0631F Electric Heating Rice Cooker from Cuckoo features a wide LCD display, six cooking settings for slow and "turbo" cooking, and can cook up to six cups of rice. The rice cooker also has an extended "keep warm" setting that can hold for up to 24 hours after cooking.
Its cooking pot is made of aluminum with a TEFLON coating to prevent sticking on the inside, and a stylish and elegant white and pink design on the outside. It would be hard not to stand out with this rice cooker on your countertop. 


best ceramic option

Image: Oster
The Good
Cooks faster because it's ceramic • Can steam veggies and make soups
The Bad
No fancy digital presets
The Bottom Line
If you're looking for speed at a good price, this is a good bet.

10. Oster Titanium Infused DuraCeramic

If you have a need for speed and don't need lots of fancy presets, this ceramic option could be the one.
  • Price: $31.90
See Details
What’s the difference between cooking with ceramic instead of non-stick stainless steel? The durability of the former will last longer and cook 30% faster. 
The Oster Titanium Infused DuraCeramic is a great rice cooker for anyone who wants to save time and energy. The ceramic is scratch resistant, while it’s also versatile and fast. It features a convenient one-touch control switch to start cooking, so it’s super easy to manage and use.
In addition, not only does the rice cooker quickly and consistently cook up to six cups of rice, but it’s also capable of steaming vegetables and fish, along with noodles, all kinds of soups, fondue, oatmeal, and grits. 
The Oster Titanium Infused DuraCeramic rice cooker also has a great price: $31.90.
